channel.title: InternetNews Realtime News for IT Managers
channel.description: All the top news, features, analysis and insight into enterprise and Internet technology, geared for IT managers and delivered by the best in the industry.

item.title: The Many, The Proud, The PCs
item.description: Buh-bye Jerry. Microsoft shifts gears with its own 'I'm a PC' campaign.

item.title: HP Slashes Corporate Marketing Staff
item.description: Reorganization results in about a hundred more pink slips at HP.

item.title: Business Getting Harder For Chip Makers
item.description: Report finds there is less room for error than ever and even the richest players are stressed.

item.title: Palin E-mail 'Hack' Was Hardly a Hack
item.description: A quick Google search yielded everything the cracker needed to know to reset Palin's Yahoo e-mail password. So what is your mother's maiden name?

item.title: CA Suit Could Be Trouble For IBM's DB2 Tools
item.description: A lawsuit launched by CA that is now in the courts may cause DB2 users some grief.

item.title: Technical Analysis: Another Sign of a Bottom
item.description: The NYSE gave another sign of a major bottom on Friday.

item.title: Investors Cheer Financial Bailout Plan
item.description: Investors responded enthusiastically Friday to the federal government's massive financial rescue plan, but the long-term process of sorting winners and losers is just beginning.

item.title: Google's Web Search Share Soars to 63 Percent
item.description: The search giant extends its lead as Yahoo drops.

item.title: Android Is No Enterprise Mobile Threat
item.description: Handset makers can't rest easy given platform's openness and consumer demands.

item.title: Web 2.0: Political Opinion 'on Steroids'
item.description: Social media is putting its stamp on the intersection of technology and politics.

item.title: Does PCI Compliance Equal Security?
item.description: Not always, but it is a step in the right direction.

item.title: Move Over for My Smartphone, Honey
item.description: Survey shows how mobile device use crosses work-life boundaries.

item.title: Palm Presses On With Mixed Earnings Report
item.description: Handset maker sees lots of challenges, and less revenue, to come.

item.title: Intel's Latest Datacenter Discovery: Fresh Air
item.description: Research project finds that air brought in from outside the datacenter is just as good as blasting the air conditioner.

item.title: Interop: Mobile Browsing Grows Up
item.description: It's no longer a desktop only world as vendors aim to make the mobile Web a reality.

item.title: Intel's Latest Datacenter Discovery: Fresh Air
item.description: Research project finds that air brought in from outside the datacenter is just as good as blasting the air conditioner.

item.title: Interop: Mobile Browsing Grows Up
item.description: It's no longer a desktop only world as vendors aim to make the mobile Web a reality.

item.title: iPhone Apps Policy Stirs Discontent
item.description: Still no word from Apple on its criteria for rejecting certain applications.

item.title: Oracle Sees Tougher Days Ahead
item.description: Yes, the past looks good, but a note of caution was quietly sounded in the forecasts.

item.title: EFF Sues Feds to Stop Domestic Spying
item.description: With suit against AT&T stalled, watchdog group opens up a new front in legal challenge to government's warrantless surveillance program.
